title: Hunt for convicted child rapist after he is mistakenly released from prison

The hunt is on to find a convicted child rapist serving a life prison sentence who was mistakenly released from jail.

Tony Maycon Munoz-Mendez was "released in error" from Rogers State Prison in Reidsville, Georgia, on Friday morning.

An appeal to find him was tweeted by Georgia Department of Corrections saying Munoz-Mendez was wanted and he should not be approached by the public.

The department describes him a a white male, 5ft 9 tall, 186lbs with brown hair and brown eyes.

The 31-year-old was jailed for life after he was found guilty of two counts of rape in 2015, WXIA-TV reports.

John Warr, the prosecutor in the trial which was held at Gwinnett County, told the station Munoz-Mendez had sexually assaulted and raped a 10-year-old girl over a period of time.

He said he couldn't understand how the blunder happened, adding: "It's incomprehensible.

"They need to re-think how they're handling their security, and how they let people out by mistake."
